intro: Thlaspidium laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth thlaspidium, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by bracts, which can be a distinctive feature. It is native to regions of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
